newsitem.title: UK: CSC to launch Durban, Cape Town operations.
newsitem.headline: CSC to launch Durban, Cape Town operations.

text.p: Air freight handler, Cargo Service Centre (CSC) said it will open its second South African facility in early summer at Durban International airport.
The company's new 400 sq m airport handling facility will be used to start an overnight trucking service to and from its existing Johannesburg operation, it added in a statement.
CSC is part of the KLM Royal Dutch Airlines NV group. It also plans to begin a Cape Town operation later this year, where it will provide a full handling service.
"Durban is not served by as many international airlines as Johannesburg and there is thus is a demand for a trucking link between the two," CSC's general manager South Africa, Eddie Buitenbos, said.
"CSC is in a very fortunate position at Johannesburg, we are one of just a handful of companies licensed to provide a full handling service at the airport," he added.

It is still reaping the benefits of business created due to the "new" South Africa which has seen more than 60 new carriers start operations to Johannesburg over the past two years alone, the statement said.
CSC also plans to offer a full handling service from Durban once the trucking operation has been established.
The existing Johannesburg operation provides full freight handling for 10 customer airlines, processing up to 40,000 tonnes of air cargo a year, the statement added.

Airlines handled by CSC in Johannesburg include Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd, Ethiopian Airlines, KLM Royal Dutch Airlines, Swissair, Austrian Airlines, Virgin Atlantic, Martinair, British Airways World Cargo, Qantas and Sabena Cargo. --Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 +Fax:5017
